Learn CartoDB

Do you want to make your own cool, interactive online map? Come to Maptime Madison this Thursday and learn how to create easy interactive maps! At this month’s Maptime, we’ll learn about CartoDB, a cloud-based mapping platform that is easy for beginners but also provides advanced functionality for mapping and programming pros. We’ll learn from @KatieKowalsky about getting started with interactive maps.

Check out the CartoDB gallery to see the types of maps that people are making with this platform. Then you’ll get a chance to make your own map, either using your own data or we will provide some. The library provides some laptops, but if you want to bring your own, feel free to do so. Aspiring mapmakers of all levels welcome, including beginners! Be sure to follow us on Twitter @MaptimeMadison to find out about future events.

Everyone is welcome and encouraged to join in on the fun!

Supplies

Bring a laptop if you want to use your own, otherwise we will have some to borrow.

When and Where?

Thursday Feb. 12 6pm - 8pm @ Madison Public Library: Central Library @ the Bubbler

201 W Mifflin St Madison, WI 53703

Join us: Thursday, Feb 12 2015
RSVP

Mapping The World with OSM

Event Recap

For our second Maptime Madison we dove in to online mapping with Open Street Map, learning about not only how to edit and add to OSM but also how to aid in the response to disasters and crises.


@Ethan talked about the importance of @Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team’s (HOT) work to respond to humanitarian disasters and how to join in on the mapping to provide a more accurate and detailed map for aid workers. Ethan also made a task in OSM Task Manager to map Madison.


@Carl went over the basics of how to edit the OSM Map. Carl also taught us about attribute tagging and OSM data structure.


We then had time to edit OSM, where some people chose a HOT Task while others filled in information about Madison and their neighborhoods. It was great fun editing and chatting with everyone about OSM.

If you missed out on joining us at the Bubbler for OSM mapping, you can view the slides and outline here on our GitHub.

Next Maptime!

Thank you to everyone who came out last night! We are looking forward to meeting up again at the end of January or early February. Where @Katie will be giving a presentation on CartoDB. Join our mailing list or follow us on Twitter @Maptime Madison for the announcement! More information to come soon!

Posted Dec 11 2014 by Rashauna

Open Street Maps

Do you think maps are cool? Do you ever wish that you could edit a map of the world? You can! At this month’s Maptime, we’ll learn about @OpenStreetMaps, a free and editable map of the world (think Google Maps meets Wikipedia). We’ll learn from @Ethan about the @Humanitarian OpenStreetMap Team’s work to respond to humanitarian disasters and then Carl will teach us how to edit the map ourselves. Then we’ll get to work and all edit OSM together! Be sure to follow us on Twitter to find out about future events: @Maptime Madison.

Supplies

Some laptops will be provided, but if you have one you can bring, please do so.

When and Where?

Tuesday December 9th 6pm - 8pm @ Madison Public Library: Central Library

201 W Mifflin St Madison, WI 53703

Join us: Tuesday, Dec 09 2014
RSVP

Hand-Drawn Maps!

Event Recap

We had such a blast at our first Maptime Madison event! Thanks to all the people that joined in on the fun.

We were so impressed with the turnout, we had almost 30 people from all walks of life, including students at UW-Madison, cartography and GIS professionals, and even some kids!

Here’s some of our new Maptimers showing off their work at the end of the night. Check out our Twitter @Maptime Madison for more images of the incredible maps our new friends made. Keep up the great work!

@DylanMoriarty led our event on hand drawn mapping and we learned a ton from his beautiful slides and live tutorial. He put his slides online available here for those who are curious about the maps he used or want to teach others! Feel free to share.

Next Maptime!

We’ll be announcing shortly about our next meeting in December. Check your inboxes or our Twitter @Maptime Madison for the announcement!

Posted Nov 12 2014 by Katie

Hand-Drawn Maps!

These days with most maps being made on the computer, Maptime Madison is going against the grain by kicking off with a session on hand-drawn maps. We’ll learn from @DylanMoriarty, a cartographer and illustrator (aka the “Bob Ross” of hand-drawn maps). We’ll go over the basic principles of cartography and put them to practice by making our own maps.

Maptime is inclusive - everyone is welcome and encouraged to join in on the fun!

Bob Ross clearly approves

Supplies

Supplies will be provided, but bring anything you like - paint, crayons, pastels, etc.

When and Where?

Wednesday Nov 5th 6pm - 8pm @ Madison Public Library: Central Library

201 W Mifflin St Madison, WI 53703

Join us: Wednesday, Nov 05 2014
RSVP

Welcome to Maptime Madison!

Maptime Madison is a monthly meetup for anyone that wants to learn about and make maps. People with all levels of mapping experience are encouraged to join. Maptime is a place for learning and a time to work collaboratively on mapping projects.

Events will be hosted in the Madison downtown area - locations and times will be posted to this site. If you have any suggestions about Maptime Madison or want to get involved let us know @MaptimeMadison or shoot us an email at maptimemadison@gmail.com.

Happy Mapping and we hope to see you at an event!

Organizers

Katie Kowalsky, @KatieKowalsky
Rashauna Mead, @RashaunaMead
Robin Tolochko, @ToloMaps

Contact

Twitter: @MaptimeMadison
Email: maptimemadison@gmail.com
